snippet: The filing by A123 Systems dealt a blow to the Obama administration’s program to jump-start a domestic battery industry and spur development of electric vehicles.
abstract: Troubled battery maker A123 Systems files for bankruptcy, dealing unexpected blow to Obama administration's program to jump-start a domestic battery industry and spur development of electric vehicles; A123 struck a deal in August to sell majority stake to Chinese auto parts manufacturer, Wanxiang Group, but that deal was never completed; agrees to sell its automotive assets and factories to Johnson Controls, another American battery producer that has benefited from federal assistance, in deal worth $125 million.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and MATTHEW L. WALD
byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald reported from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The filing by A123 Systems dealt a blow to the Obama administration’s program to jump-start a domestic battery industry and spur development of electric vehicles.

headline.seo: Battery Maker A123 Systems Files for Bankruptcy
headline.main: Maker of Batteries Files for Bankruptcy
